business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag market in early trade; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 206.29 points to 74,133.80, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 63.30 points to 22,481.40 as of 9:17 AM.

Tariff uncertainty clobbers US markets, Nasdaq crashes 10%, S&P slidesStocks fell even though President Trump offered a one-month reprieve from his 25% tariffs on many goods imported from Mexico and Canada. That's unlike the bounce stocks got the prior day from his giving a one-month exemption specifically for automakers.

India to monitor negotiations before taking a call on US tariffs: Finance MinisterFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal is currently in the United States for discussions, and India will wait for the outcome before taking a stance.
L&T introduces one-day paid menstrual leave for women employeesThe announcement was made by Chairman and Managing Director S N Subrahmanyan during an event held to mark International Women's Day.

Bitcoin prices fall 5% after Donald Trump orders US strategic reserveBitcoin prices dropped over 5% a day before Donald Trump is set to meet with top executives from the cryptocurrency industry at the White House.

Gold loans under under scanner as RBI plans stricter norms for lenders: Report The RBI wants banks and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) to conduct deeper background checks on borrowers and verify the ownership of the gold being pledged.
DA hike? Will central government employees receive good news before Holi?The government reviews DA twice a year; the January hike is announced around Holi, while July revision is around Diwali.

5 special fixed deposits offering up to 8.05% interest. Check details  These fixed deposits are available only for a limited period, with the last date for investing in these schemes being March 31, 2025.
Sensex rises 600 points, Nifty nears 22,550 as auto and metal stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 609.86 points to close at 74,340.09, while the NSE Nifty50 added 207.40 points to end at 22,544.70.

Britannia Industries CEO Rajneet Singh Kohli resignsKohli submitted his resignation on March 5, 2025, and the Board of Directors has taken note of it through a circular resolution passed on March 6, 2025. He will be relieved from his duties at the close of business hours on March 14, 2025.

You don't need employer's permission for these EPF account changesIf your UAN is already linked to Aadhaar, you can update personal details like name, date of birth, gender, nationality, parents' names, marital status, spouse's name, date of joining, and date of leaving, all without submitting any documents.

Sensex gains 600 points: Why is stock market rising despite early losses?Stock market gains: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 475.17 points to 74,205.40, while the NSE Nifty50 added 171.30 points to 22,508.60 as of 2:20 PM.

entertainment.headline: Friends actor recalls 'toxic environment' on set: I had become so race-consciousActor Stephen Park shared his negative experiences on the set of Friends, highlighting racial insensitivity. He recalled an incident involving an assistant director's offensive remarks towards fellow actor James Hong.

BB 17's Ayesha Khan faints while shooting, video goes viralBigg Boss 17 fae Ayesha Khan fainted on the sets of her upcoming project. Reportedly, the incident took place on Kapil Sharma's Kis Kisko Pyaar Karun set.

Nora Fatehi, Jason Durelo teach Kelly Clarkson Snake hook step. WatchKelly Clarkson welcomed Nora Fatehi and Jason Derulo on her talk show, where they showcased their latest hit, Snake, and even taught Kelly the hook step.

Lisa Kudrow's No Good Deed: This dark comedy could have been darker and funnierLisa Kudrow and Ray Romano are beloved comedic actors. And they deserved better treatment than Netflix's No Good Deed, which is fine at best. The series is currently streaming on the OTT platform.

With Love, Meghan review: You are neither fancy nor rich enough for Markle's show Released-Wed Mar 05, 2025With Love, Meghan could have been a lovely show about cooking and lifestyle, but it becomes a window into Markle's pretentiousness. It can't do away with its elitism, the one thing that Markle stood against during her stint at the royal palace.

Netflix cancels Noah Centineo-led The Recruit after 2 seasonsStreaming giant Netflix has cancelled actor Noah Centineo-starrer The Recruit after only two seasons. The news was recently confirmed by the OTT platform.

Daredevil Born Again review: An uneven but triumphant return of Hell's Kitchen's devilReleased-Wed Mar 05, 2025Matt Murdock is back as Hell's Kitchen's favourite vigilante in Marvel Studios' Daredevil Born Again. The show had its two-episode premiere on March 5 and can be streamed on JioHotstar.

Ali Fazal trains 7 hours a day for Rakht Brahmand, learns ancient martial artsAli Fazal undergoes 7-hour daily training, learning martial arts and perfecting diction for Rakht Brahmand. He calls the process "demanding but rewarding." The series also stars Samantha Ruth Prabhu.
Bigg Boss 17's Anurag Dobhal gets engaged to girlfriend RitikaBigg Boss 17's Anurag Dobhal got engaged to his girlfriend Ritika Chauhan. The vlogger shared pictures on Instagram on March 5.

Madhavan, Nayanthara, Siddharth's Netflix film Test to premiere on April 4Madhavan, Nayanthara, and Siddharth star in Test, a Tamil Netflix film exploring life's biggest challenges beyond cricket. Directed by S. Sashikanth, it will stream from April 4.

Liam Payne's girlfriend breaks down remembering singer, says 'can't fully accept'One Direction singer Liam Payne's untimely demise has left his girlfriend Kate Cassidy grappling with grief. In a heartfelt interview, she talked about her struggles and healing journey.

Actor Parambrata jokes about playing a cop ahead of Khakee: The Bengal ChapterActor Parambrata Chattopadhyay recently joked about playing a police officer ahead of his Netflix series, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter. The actor even shared reasons behind nodding to feature in the political drama.

general news.headline: 26/11 accused Tahawwur Rana's plea to pause extradition rejected by US courtTahawwur Rana's extradition was approved by US President Donald Trump during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Washington last month. Rana, 63, is currently lodged at a jail in Los Angeles.

After praise for counterterrorism, Trump set to impose travel ban on Pak: ReportThe Donald Trump administration is set to impose travel ban on Pakistan and Afghanistan following a review of countries' security and vetting risks. The ban is set to take effect as soon as next week.

Yogi Adityanath, Rekha Gupta to Aamir Khan: Powerhouses to unite at Conclave 2025The India Today Conclave, scheduled for March 7-8 in Delhi, will see an eclectic mix of politicians, cinema stars, sportspersons, entrepreneurs, and cultural icons delve into this year's theme - 'Age of Acceleration'.

Islam a scientific religion: Congress leader's take on Mohammed Shami's roza rowCongress leader Shama Mohamed defended Indian pacer Mohammed Shami after Maulana Shahabuddin Razvi Bareilvi called him a "criminal" for skipping roza during India's Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia.

How Mona hid the sona. Gold smugglers and their sneaky tricksRanya Rao, actor and daughter of a top police officer, was nabbed while trying to smuggle gold into India. She was concealing gold bars in her clothing. Gold is among the top items smuggled into India, and in recent times, smugglers have become innovative and found new ways to sneak in the precious metal into India.

Nitin Gadkari blames civil engineers for road accidents: File cases against themUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari blamed civil engineers and flawed road designs for rising accidents, urging legal action against those responsible for faulty project reports.

Watch: Elon Musk's Starship explodes in space, crashes over BahamasThe Starship rocket, designed to be the most powerful ever built, was intended to conduct a suborbital flight, deploying four dummy Starlink satellites and testing reentry maneuvers.

Khalistani thugs: UK MP raises alarm over S Jaishankar's London security breachThe incident took place in London on March 6 when a protester ran in front of S Jaishankar's stationary car, waving a flag, but, according to UK Police, was "quickly intercepted by officers and moved out of the way".

Watch: Air Force's C-17 Globemaster lands on Kargil airstrip for first time The C-17's ability to carry over 25 tonnes - up to 35 tonnes in winter - will enhance the IAF's transport capacity, making it easier to move troops and military supplies to posts near the Line of Actual Control.

Holi comes once a year, Friday namaz 52 times: UP cop's remark triggers rowA Sambhal police officer's advice for those uncomfortable with Holi colours to stay indoors has sparked political backlash, with opposition leaders condemning the remarks as biased and demanding action.

England Cricket Board issues apology for 'ill-judged' Pope Francis jokeThe England and Wales Cricket Board faced backlash after joking about Pope Francis "loving the Ashes" in response to his Ash Wednesday message. The post was deleted, and ECB issued an apology for the insensitivity.

Trump's message for stranded Sunita Williams: We love you, coming up to get youSunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who flew to the International Space Station on Boeing's faulty Starliner capsule in June 2024, will now have to wait until their replacements arrive next week before they can check out later this month.

Video: Chaos on US flight as woman passenger strips naked, runs around screamingA Southwest flight from Houston to Phoenix was forced to return to the gate after a woman stripped naked, screamed, and roamed the aisle for 25 minutes, even banging on the cockpit door.

Iron nails driven into feet, woman's battered body turns up on Bihar roadsideA woman's body was found in Bihar's Nalanda district with multiple injuries and nails driven into her feet. Police are investigating all angles and seeking public help in identifying her. A post-mortem will aid the inquiry.

BJP MP Tejasvi Surya marries Carnatic singer Sivasri Skandaprasad in BengaluruBJP MP Tejasvi Surya married Carnatic singer Sivasri Skandaprasad in a traditional ceremony in Bengaluru, attended by top BJP leaders, with images from the event widely shared on social media.
L&T introduces one-day paid menstrual leave for women employeesThe announcement was made by Chairman and Managing Director S N Subrahmanyan during an event held to mark International Women's Day.

Hrithik Roshan is ex-wife Sussanne's biggest cheerleader, attends event in HyderabadHrithik Roshan is his ex-wife Sussanne Khan's biggest cheerleader. As they continue to support each other, Hrithik recently attended the launch of Sussanne's interior design venture in Hyderabad.

After Mexico, Trump pauses tariffs on some Canadian goods US President Donald Trump suspended 25 per cent tariffs on Canadian and Mexican goods until April 2. Canada delayed retaliatory tariffs. The move follows concerns over trade uncertainty, inflation, and economic slowdown. Markets reacted negatively.

Baywatch actor Pamela Bach, ex-wife of David Hasselhoff, dies by suicide at 62Actor Pamela Bach, aged 62, was found at her home in Hollywood Hills on March 5. The police confirmed that she died by suicide. She was the ex-wife of David Hasselhoff.

Israel rescues 10 Indian construction workers from West BankTen Indian construction workers were rescued from a West Bank village after being held for over a month. Israeli authorities said Palestinians seized their passports for illegal border crossings. The workers are now in a safe location.

Karnataka bodybuilder bride's wedding look video goes viral with 7 million viewsEmbracing both tradition and strength, Chitra Purushotham flaunted her muscular physique while dressed in an elegant yellow and blue Kanjivaram saree.

Take back areas under China as well: Omar Abdullah after Jaishankar's PoK remarkS Jaishankar, at a London event, said the Kashmir dispute will be resolved after the "return of the stolen part" under Pakistan. Omar Abdullah asks what is stopping the Centre from reclaiming it.

Watch: SpaceX catches Super Heavy rocket falling from spaceThe Super Heavy booster, after executing a boostback burn, was caught by the giant metal arms of the launch tower, known as Mechazilla, at Starbase in Texas.

PM Modi receives top Barbados award for 'strategic leadership' in Covid crisisPrime Minister Narendra Modi received the 'Honorary Order of Freedom of Barbados' for his leadership during the Covid-19 pandemic. Minister Pabitra Margherita accepted the award in Bridgetown, highlighting India-Barbados ties and international cooperation.

Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas's dinner outing in New York, Malti busy on phonePriyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas, and Malti Marie dined out in New York, joined by Nick's father. Fans adored their family photos.

Singer Kalpana says no differences with husband amid suicide attempt reportsPlayback singer Kalpana Raghavendar, in a video message, explained that she had no differences with her husband and her daughter as reports claimed. She stated that she overdosed on sleeping pills and did not attempt suicide.

Vijay Varma's first appearance after breakup rumours with Tamannaah BhatiaActor Vijay Varma was seen avoiding the paparazzi during his first public appearance following rumours of a breakup with Tamannaah Bhatia. The actor seemed keen to maintain his privacy amid the ongoing speculation.

Suhana Khan, Agastya Nanda dine out with Shweta Bachchan amid dating rumoursSuhana Khan and Agastya Nanda dined out with Shweta Bachchan, avoiding paparazzi. The rumoured couple previously celebrated New Year together.

sports.headline: Bear with the bullies: Is powerhouse India facing fair scrutiny or sour grapes?India's dominance in cricket sparks controversy as critics question fairness of the side playing all their Champions Trophy fixtures in Dubai and not the original venue in Pakistan. India face off against New Zealand in the Champions Trophy Final on March 9.

Amorim promises 'different' Manchester United after Sociedad drawRuben Amorim assured Manchester United fans of a stronger, more focused performance at Old Trafford in their Europa League second leg against Real Sociedad, promising tactical improvements after their first-leg struggles in the 1-1 draw.

Suryakumar defends Rohit amid 'captaincy' row: Led us to 4 ICC FinalsSuryakumar Yadav defended Rohit Sharma against criticism, highlighting his leadership in guiding India to four ICC finals. He reminded of Rohit leading India to the 2024 T20 World Cup triumph, as the team gears up for the Champions Trophy final against New Zealand.

England Cricket Board issues apology for 'ill-judged' Pope Francis jokeThe England and Wales Cricket Board faced backlash after joking about Pope Francis "loving the Ashes" in response to his Ash Wednesday message. The post was deleted, and ECB issued an apology for the insensitivity.

IND vs NZ: Virat Kohli's calmness gives Gautam Gambhir's India its ODI identityIn an era when every team needs to have an 'identity', India's ODI team under Gautam Gambhir is deriving its spirit from the calmness of Virat Kohli. The star batter has been in sensational form for India in the Champions Trophy.

UP Warriorz all but knocked out as Matthews, Kerr power MI to 6-wicket winHayley Matthews smashed a 46-ball 68, while Amelia Kerr registered her best figures of 5/38 as Mumbai Indians stormed to a six-wicket win over UP Warriorz in the Women's Premier League.

Mitchell Santner banking on form ahead of final, says extra travel part of jobNew Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner said that he was banking on his team's form ahead of the Champions Trophy final against India. New Zealand beat South Africa in a high-scoring contest to reach the summit clash.

Champions Trophy 2025 Final: ICC announces umpiring line-upPaul Reiffel and Richard Illingworth, two of the most respected names amongst the umpires are set to officiate the Champions Trophy Final between India and New Zealand on Sunday, March 9.

Champions Trophy: Team flops. Did Pakistan fare better as hosts?Pakistan are not playing the final of an ICC tournament, that they hosted after much drama. While their cricket team has been a failure, how did Pakistan do as the hosts of the Champions Trophy 2025?

Sunil Chhetri comes out of international retirement, to play in FIFA's March windowSunil Chhetri has performed a retirement U-turn as he will be back in India colours during the March international window, AIFF announced on March 6. Chhetri retired from football in 2024.

Ben Stokes as England white-ball captain? Rob Key says 'nothing's off the table'England's managing director of men's cricket Rob Key has hinted that Ben Stokes could be an option to be the new white-ball captain after their exit from the Champions Trophy. Jos Buttler stepped down from his role as captain following their exit from the tournament.

Mitchell Santner banking on form ahead of final, says extra travel part of jobNew Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner said that he was banking on his team's form ahead of the Champions Trophy final against India. New Zealand beat South Africa in a high-scoring contest to reach the summit clash.

Champions Trophy 2025 Final: ICC announces umpiring line-upPaul Reiffel and Richard Illingworth, two of the most respected names amongst the umpires are set to officiate the Champions Trophy Final between India and New Zealand on Sunday, March 9.

Champions Trophy: Team flops. Did Pakistan fare better as hosts?Pakistan are not playing the final of an ICC tournament, that they hosted after much drama. While their cricket team has been a failure, how did Pakistan do as the hosts of the Champions Trophy 2025?

Sunil Chhetri comes out of international retirement, to play in FIFA's March windowSunil Chhetri has performed a retirement U-turn as he will be back in India colours during the March international window, AIFF announced on March 6. Chhetri retired from football in 2024.

Ben Stokes as England white-ball captain? Rob Key says 'nothing's off the table'England's managing director of men's cricket Rob Key has hinted that Ben Stokes could be an option to be the new white-ball captain after their exit from the Champions Trophy. Jos Buttler stepped down from his role as captain following their exit from the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
